website_summaries.verdict: A hard back with elastic closure make it easy to use on the go. Offers lots of options for use because of its features.
pros: Thick, creamy paper that doesn't let ink bleed through
Index and numbered pages to track months or dedicated sections
Pocket in back to store keepsakes
Can be used as a journal, calendar, or appointment organizer
cons: May not need an index if its being used strictly for journaling
Not everyone will like or need the dotted paper

customer_reviews.title: Maybe not for everyone, but I love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is really working for me! If you're interested in using a bullet journal, watch a few YouTube videos on it first. If you don't already know, this thing is blank with a dot matrix, it gives no guidance. That may seem overly simple for a journal/planner. But if you've tried lots of planners before and gotten bored with them because they don't do something you need them to do, this may be the system for you. Oh, and don't be intimidated by all the videos with beautiful journals, boasting calligraphy and artsy doodles. I CANNOT DRAW ! But people think I'm artsy just cause the dots help guide your handwriting and whatnot. Give it a try!
customer_reviews.author: Roni Garrison-Joyner

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The paper is SO THIN!! I’ve tried multiple pens and markers and everything shows through the opposite side, enough that you cannot write on both sides. So angry I went with an expensive yet crappy journal.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa

customer_reviews.title: FAKE DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: FAKE journal. The font is wrong, the spacing is wrong, and the paper is wrong. This is a FAKE Leuchttrum journal. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa MullinsTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: The index is pretty and like the pocket
customer_reviews.text: I use this for billet journaling and am obsessed. The index is pretty and like the pocket. My one complaint is the paper is pretty thin making the pen visible on the next page. The sturdy leather cover makes it easy to just through in my purse - definately a plus
customer_reviews.author: megan wilson

customer_reviews.title: Obsessed with this! Love the color options.
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this for a day and I'm already converted from Moleskine forever. I'm using this for a new bullet journal and it works perfectly. It's a little wider than a Moleskine, which was ultimately why I chose it over that brand. I love that it has numbered pages and an index, and the paper is a great quality and doesn't bleed through with my Staedler Pigment Liners and Zebra Mildliner highlighters.
customer_reviews.author: Amber M.Top Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty excited to begin my first bullet journal, but ended up getting super disappointed by how thin the paper is. I can easily see what I wrote through multiple pages, which is bad considering I wanted to draw a lot in this journal as well as write. For the price this notebook was not worth it. I expected thicker, more quality paper. Or, at least a paper that prevented more ghosting than this. Other than that, I liked small perks like the page numbers.
customer_reviews.author: GD

customer_reviews.title: Better than Moleskine Notebooks
customer_reviews.text: Love this notebook. Paper quality is wonderful with little to no bleed (less than Moleskine). I love that it has a table of content and numbered pages. I used to be a Moleskine fan but have since converted for my bullet journals. This notebook travels with me very single day and has stood up - I've had it close to a year and no issues with loose pages. The cover is a bit battered but that's because it gets thrown into tote bags, back packs and on desks. It's traveled to many states with me. I cross the strap across the cover and use it to hold a pen which makes it even more convenient.
customer_reviews.author: NikkiKuhl

customer_reviews.title: ... picked up Bullet-Journaling and after researching which notebook was best, I decided on this one
customer_reviews.text: Recently picked up Bullet-Journaling and after researching which notebook was best, I decided on this one, mostly due to the dotted pages, page numbers, and folder in the back. I was afraid the Berry color would be too overwhelmingly punk, but I was wrong. I also mainly purchsed this due to it being "ink resistant", but upon writing in it, I learned quickly that some markers and pens will bleed through and ghost. I wish the pages were a little thicker. I had to skip some pages due to the bleeding of the marker. Currently testing all my markers/pens to see which works best.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this journal because it was the one everyone was talking about. Once I got it, and tried it, I hated it. The ghosting on the pages was terrible!! Even after writing on the other side, it was still clearly seen. I am extremely unhappy with the journal, and will not ever purchase another one.
customer_reviews.author: Smiths

customer_reviews.title: Great for bullet journaling
customer_reviews.text: This is my second journal for bullet journaling and I love it. My first was a moleskin, but the Leuchturm is much better. Paper is quite a bit thicker, and although some markers do show through the pages a little, it doesn't bleed through like the moleskin did. I love the dot pattern, I find it just as easy to write on as ruled pages, but it is easier on my eyes. Will definitely be sticking with this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Tm

customer_reviews.title: This journal is haunted there's so much ghosting
customer_reviews.text: I've used a few Leuchtturm 1917's before this one and I haven't had such bad ghosting, even using the same markers and pens. Not only can I see everything on the back of a page, but I can see everything on the page underneath that one. What's odd is that I'm pretty sure I ordered from my previous order, so I'm not sure if this is a knock off as another reviewer suggested, or if they just lowered the quality of their paper. Either way I'm not excited to use this as my bullet journal for the next 6+ months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it!
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY wanted to love this. I mean, it’s an expensive journal! Such a disappointment. Simple pens ghost on this super thin paper, you can even see it through multiple pages! Really ticked at the waste of money. If you’re looking for a really good journal, with thick pages and little to no ghosting at all, go with the BooQool. You get 2 journals for less than one of these. Never purchasing again. I actually want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn Sonsalla

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these before and they have been amazing, but this time it's an epic fail! I think the quality has gone downhill drastically. If I could give it no stars I would! Despite being very careful with the book the binding is already very loose and makes noise after less than a month of use. My previous ones I used for more than a year and the binding was not loose at all, nor was there any noise.
customer_reviews.author: SSOHSS

customer_reviews.title: Don't be fooled! Pages transparent!
customer_reviews.text: I thought Leuchtturm1917 was famous for its thick pages and quality. Nothing can be further from the truth. The pages are practically transparent. Literally: TRANSPARENT! My 15 dollar Moleskin is 100 times superior and even some no-name Chinese brand would probably fare better. Buyer beware! This one goes straight to trash.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Not your old Leuchtturm1917
customer_reviews.text: This is not the quality of previous versions -- I have years worth. They are completely different. Pages are glued haphazardly, pages don't lie correctly, the dots and numbers are all misaligned. Paper is rougher, dots are darker. This book is trash.
customer_reviews.author: We are Thrifty!

customer_reviews.title: Great notebook
customer_reviews.text: I love the Leuchtturm1917 brand. The dotted notebooks are great! I actually have an older version of this in black and I have to say the new version has some slight differences (not necessarily improvements or drawbacks). The biggest thing for me is that the newer versions now have several perforated and detachable pages towards the end which are great from testing writing instruments/mediums. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Kaguya

customer_reviews.title: Super thin pages
customer_reviews.text: I love the color and some features of this bullet journal such as the table of contents, two page markers, and pocket on the inside of the back cover. However, the pages are incredibly thin! If you plan to do any elaborate bullet journaling be prepared to have bleeding through the pages. The journal I used last year is half the price of this one but has much thicker pages, so I would shop around and do your research. For the price I would have expected this to be much better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful but ghosts pages
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size. Beautiful color. Love that the pages are numbers and it’s akresdy set up for the index. Unfortunately there is ghosting behind the pages. I was quite disappointed with this since the rest is so wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Wizmedic30

customer_reviews.title: Paper Quality is lacking
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid diarist, and was very excited to begin using my new pretty yellow journal. I tried out all my favorite pens on the first page, and found that the paper was so thin I could see the writing not only on the next page, but on the page after as well. Additionally, even light pressure from a rollerball ben causes "embossing" on the next few pages. Not complete unusable, just extremely irritating for anyone using pens of any kind. Aside from the issues with the paper, the Journal is exceptionally beautiful and well made, the numbered pages are a wonderful feature. unsure of how long it will last with regular use.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Blackford

customer_reviews.title: I love these
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Leuchtturm 1917 and honestly I love them. I know a lot of people hate the ghosting but I don’t mind it. It actually makes it easier to copy a weekly spread onto the next page. I think The key is finding a good pen. I use different size microns and those are my favorite. They dry fast and don’t leave an indent. It’s nice. I love that the journal it’s self lays flat. Makes for easy writing in it. I love the size of these journals and happy to get a green one this time.
customer_reviews.author: jcmill

customer_reviews.title: Ideal Notebook
customer_reviews.text: I'd always been a Moleskine girl, but my loyalties have shifted. This paper is higher quality; some have described it as waxy, but I haven't noticed that at all. It's smooth, takes ink well, doesn't bleed (even with a fountain pen), and is only slightly transparent. It's ideal for a bullet journal, since the pages are already numbered, the index is pre-made, and the dot grid guides your text or other designs, but it would work for any purpose. I also love the variety of color; I plan to get one in red too!
customer_reviews.author: BryherOShae

customer_reviews.title: You can only use one side of the paper.  It is THIN.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love my Leuchtturm. Everything about it was great --except for the paper. Too bad, that is a deal killer. The paper is so thin that even using a light, narrow pen I could literally read everything backwards on the other side of the page. It's not just a little bit too thin. It's WAY too thin. I've never seen paper this thin that wasn't onionskin. Think of it as a product that has half the advertised pages for the same bulk. I would love a Leuchtturm product that had good paper in it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a real Leuchtturm1917
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered several Leuchtturm1917s from Amazon and have been happy. But when I went to set up my next bullet journal I noticed that there were a different number of rows per page, the font was different, the info page had a different layout, and the pages seemed thinner. When I went to research all of the changes, guess what!?!?!? there weren't any! I am returning this and I will find a new source for my bullet journals.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Messenger

customer_reviews.title: My 5th Leuchtturm...
customer_reviews.text: ....and I still have to double-triple check the spelling every time. I highly recommend these journals to anyone who asks. The dot-grid system adds extra versatility and endless customization options. I’ve used the bullet journal method for a few years now and couldn’t imagine life without it. These journals are sturdy, durable, and extremely affordable. They usually last me about 6 months which makes them perfect for Christmas or birthday gifts if my family is out of ideas. Great for note taking, journaling, list making, goal tracking, organization, etc. like I said, the possibilities are endless 10/10. Gold Star. Highly Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Ok notebook but does not live up to the hype.
customer_reviews.text: This notebook is fine. I was disappointed in the quality of the paper. My expectation was that it would be better than my scribbles that matter notebook, since the 1917 is so popular with the bujo community but it does not compare. You can see the writing from my Tombow pens through the pages, as they are extremely thin. I will keep this book since I am determined to finish a bullet journal once I start it, but I will not be purchasing the Leuchtturm 1917 again.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Sadly, the paper is too thin, see-through thin. It would otherwise be a good journal notebook.
customer_reviews.text: I use notebooks like this for Bullet Journaling. This one fails one essential test. The paper is too thin, and writing on the opposite side of a page shows through. Very disappointing. Otherwise, it is well printed, well bound. I prefer my previous Poluma brand. Though it has fewer pages, the paper is a good thickness for the purpose. It’s not that the paper bleeds through, because I use pens carefully selected NOT to be too wet. But really thin paper is naturally translucent.
customer_reviews.author: Einsteigen

customer_reviews.title: Color off, but quality good
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy Leuchtturms, but the color I received does not seem to match the image online. I ordered Pacific Green, and the one I received appears dark blue.
customer_reviews.author: Amy W.

customer_reviews.title: Fake - don’t buy this.
customer_reviews.text: This product is fake. This is not an actual leuchttrum dotted notebook. There are 38 X 27 dots per page. Leuchttrum manufactures notebooks with 39 x 27 dots per page. This notebook has 12 perforated pages in the back vice 8 that are in a legitimate leuchttrum. I didn’t realize this was a fake until I started to lay out my bullet journal and realized the discrepancy in dots. There is also a lot of glue sticking pages together near the binding throughout the book - not something you find in a legit leuchttrum.
customer_reviews.author: Ana B.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of ghosting
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this notebook for my bullet journal. I have recently been using a lined Rhodia journal with 90 gsm paper and loved the paper. I started to use the Leuchtturm 1917 with a Pilot G2 0.38 black pen. The ghosting on each page was unbearable.
customer_reviews.author: MusicGirl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for journaling!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great journal for bullet journaling. I've purchased more than one of them and they work perfectly for me. Pros: - Good size for planning - Commonly used for bullet journaling - Most pens and markers I've used don't bleed through - I like the dot grid because it allows me to be flexible with the pages: use them as lines for writing, use them as guides for drawing, etc. Cons: - Every once in a while there are two pages that are stuck together near the binding. - Bookmark ribbons get in the way sometimes
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best Dot Grid Journal Available
customer_reviews.text: I buy one or two of these a year to use for a "work diary". Helps me to stay focused and get things done. These notebooks are VERY well made and will easily stay together and look good for a year of daily use. The paper quality is excellent. The labels are a bonus. I can mark the notebooks with the date range they contain and if anyone comes back to me and says "what did you do this day" I can go back YEARS and find it. A great way to document and stay organized.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Brown

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Ghosting.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item because all the bullet journal enthusiasts seem to love this brand! I'm not crazy about it at all. The ghosting through the pages is annoying and I can't even use my no bleed sharpies which is my pen of choice. They don't bleed, but the ghosting is darker than the ball point pen that I am currently using. For $20 for this book, I expected more. I will not be buying again since I get better value from a $10 dot journal by Peter Pauper Press. I'm also looking to see how the Lemome journals pan out.
customer_reviews.author: Tina V

customer_reviews.title: Overall worth it
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Love the bright colors of the covers. Pages are more of a cream instead of a harsh bright white. Pocket in the back is a great idea! Two book marks! Cons: Pages are a bit thinner than I would hope for. Paper mate Ink Joy pens bleed right through pages. Pocket in the back is a bit flimsy and doesn’t see secured enough. When writing, you can see the indent up for 10 pages later. A felt-tip pen or marker might have to prevent this.
customer_reviews.author: Sixoh3Princess

customer_reviews.title: Love this! The color
customer_reviews.text: Love this! The color, the numbering system, the dot grid is the correct strength and size to my liking, the quality of the paper, the size of the journal itself for tossing in my bag. I have had this for about a month now and have nothing negative to say about it. Started my first bullet-style journal with this and cannot imagine using anything different.
customer_reviews.author: C. Easter

customer_reviews.title: Ghosting of Pages, but worth the Buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a bullet journal, I love the size of the notebook. I have noticed when I use my black Inkjoy Gel pens that there is a lot of ghosting on the pages, I switched over to a purple sharpie fine pen and haven't had as many issues with the ghosting since. I'm thinking I may need to try out the next size up in the Leuchtturm notebooks just to see how much more I am able to add to my Bujo spread. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Gapen

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this notebook and a Clever Fox notebook. I had planned on using the leuchtturm1917 for bullet journaling, but after beginning to use it, the ghosting was horrible. I switched to the Clever Fox because I can use my same pens, highlighters, and watercolor markers without the annoying ghosting. Though I like the leuchtturm1917, it ended up not working for me. I'm sure it is perfect for other uses. I was honestly surprised by the thin paper. I think it will work well with my pencils, but even regular pen markings were annoyingly visible through the paper.
customer_reviews.author: Mik

customer_reviews.title: Subpar
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good notebook if you don't plan on using mediums that are too heavy in it, such as markers, brush pens, paint, etc. Maybe if you're just using colored pencils and regular pens you'd be fine but the pages are too thin to hold up to markers and the ghosting on the other side of the page is a total deal breaker for me. The whole reason I got a bullet journal with so many pages was to actually use them, not to have to glue them together to make the ghosting less obvious. I'd suggest trying the Artist Loft notebooks from Michael's with the 120 gsm pages. Much better as far as ghosting goes
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: The Gold Standard in Dot Journals
customer_reviews.text: The Lechtturm Dot Journal is the industry standard in Dot Journals. It has a hard cover and comes in a wide variety of colors. The paper is cream-colored with pale gray dots, so essentially is a blank slate for creative journaling and planning. An elastic band holds the journal closed when not in use and two ribbon bookmarks help you to keep your place. I find the paper a bit thin to get use out of both sides of the paper when using ink; I suppose I could use pencil, but that’s not as much fun.
customer_reviews.author: iconoclast

customer_reviews.title: Held up through a year of heavy daily use!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this journal!!! I am a daily bullet journaler who uses this journal as a sort of planner and then some. I started this journal in May 2019 and finished with it in April 2020. It held up through the entire year and the cover is still intact as well as the spine. I highly recommend this company for bullet journaling! These journal come premade with a Table of contents, numbered pages, and many more benefits. Try out this great journal and you likely will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Smcneil

customer_reviews.title: This is what I was looking for in a great quality notebook.
customer_reviews.text: The price, at first, made me as skeptic as I am when it comes to Moleskines. However, when I received it, I immediately was impressed with the amount of detail and added features of this dot-grid notebook. There's a lot of options for organization, a dedicated set of pages for a table of contents, sticker labels for the front and spine of the notebook, and a pocket folder to store pages in. I'll be picking up more of these in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Dubois

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I love this journal. It is sturdy and well made. I use it for a reading journal, and it's perfect for that. I especially like that the pages are numbered, which allows you to personalize your table of contents. I also like that there's an expandable pocket inside the back cover where you can keep notes, receipts, etc. The only issue I had was that I ordered navy blue, and just 1 day after my return window closed, I unwrapped it to see that I got black instead. It isn't the end of the world, but I'm a bit disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful bullet journal
customer_reviews.text: I decided I wanted to start using a bullet journal, and this particular journal came highly recommended for that purpose. I was put off at first by the cost as I didn't want to spend that much at first. However, after getting one I can say that I love it. I bought theto go with it. I love these pens because I prefer .7 and these do not smudge. They also don't bleed through the page. Overall, I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JTaylor

customer_reviews.title: Intelligent design elements are appreciated.
customer_reviews.text: Sketching and journaling-, my favorite multi purpose journal. Double book marks, sturdy elastic, dots aid for journaling, and some sketching notes. The numbered pages help retrieve information. No bleeding w standard pens, enough pages to hold a good body of notes, larger projects or trips. Color selection terrific so I can color code by project or time segment. Binding holds up to being over stuffed w notes and a pen. I especially appreciate the high quality elastic. For serious trips with lots of sketching and some painting or markers I shift to a heavier paper journal like a Moleskin.
customer_reviews.author: Becky T.

customer_reviews.title: Great for bullet journaling
customer_reviews.text: I bought this journal to make a bullet journal for a friend and really loved it. I do go heavy on colors and they did bleed a little, hence 4 stars. Additionally some of the pages stuck together at the seam and ripped when evening them out. Overall great journal and good price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, thin pages
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful book but I agree with some other reviewers that the pages are thin. I come from Erin Condren world and wow these pages are not up to that quality. I will be using this book as a work bullet journal; I’m running an EC bullet journal for personal use. I suggest writing in pencil - the pages cannot withstand strong ink without bleed through. I got it in green and it’s beautiful and fits easily in my bag. Not sure if I’d repurchase, but I will use this book.
customer_reviews.author: Zen Girl

customer_reviews.title: Very nice notebook
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for bullet journaling and it is exactly what I wanted out of a notebook. The quality is great. It's very well bound and the pages quality is perfect. They pages aren't so thick they're annoying and I haven't run into any issues with bleed through writing with fountain pens. The table of contents and page numbers are both nice features. I like the flexibility of dots over lines. And including multiple book marks is very handy for keeping track of multiple collections. This is expensive for a notebook but the little features make it worth spending a little extra.
customer_reviews.author: Matt H.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love it as a bullet journal. Especially when I can customize it how I want. Picture below, is my April planning spreed. P.s Watching Harry Potter
customer_reviews.author: Muzique

customer_reviews.title: Awful. Disappointing. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to trying the Leuchtturm 1917. I even bought two! I only opened one. It has always come up as one of the highest rated notebooks for bullet journaling and I was so excited. The first thing I do in every journal of mine is to do a pen test to see which types of pens bleed through the paper. Not only did every pen bleed right through, the pencil did too! A PENCIL. I could see what I wrote in pencil through the paper. The paper is ridiculously thin and beyond disappointing. I want a refund. For a $20 notebook, this is ridiculous. Let alone 2 for $40.
customer_reviews.author: M R Srhew

customer_reviews.title: 3/5 - Better Options Out There
customer_reviews.text: I used the Leuchtturm1917 for two years (2017-2018) then switched to the Lemome Notebook (available here on Amazon) for 2019. This year (2020) I switched back to the Leuchtturm because it has more pages. Unfortunately, after a year with the thicker pages of the Lemome, I find myself disappointed. The thin pages of the Leuchtturm results in very bad ghosting and some bleeding. I'll stick with my current Leuchtturm until I fill it, then I'll search around for a different notebook.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Leck

customer_reviews.title: Amazing journal... If you use the right pens
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is an amazing journal. The cover has a great "feel" that doesn't feel like a fake leather substitute. Instead, it has a very smooth feel that is rigid enough to resist bending if it is thrown in a bag. Two fabric bookmarks, a binding strap and a pocket on the last page are also included to make it more usable. The lay flat binding design works well without weakening the binding. It is easy to see why this is a highly ranked journal. The downside for me is that the paper is thinner. 80g Depending on the pens you use, there will be a lot of ghosting or bleed through to the other side of the page.
customer_reviews.author: Lara

customer_reviews.title: will buy only dotted leuchtturm from now on
customer_reviews.text: I love my yellow dotted leuchtturm. will never go back to lined journals again. I wish I could get these locally. moleskine dotted journals exist, but not in these colors the price for these journals shot up since I bought mine in November 2015. yikes, I'll have to shop around for another. I bought mine for only sixteen.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Nice journal, great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday present for my 10 year old granddaughter who wants to bullet journal like her aunt. I wanted something nice and was worried it would be of cheap quality but didn't want to spend a fortune since I wanted to buy necessary goodies to go with it, pens, markers, stencils, etc. ( I have 8 grandkids and it requires a birthday budget) My daughter uses a brand of bullet journal that is twice the price of this one and when she saw this journal she said the quality was equally good. I am really pleased with this product, it's good quality for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: What happened to the paper quality????
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Leuchtturm1917 and the paper quality is not at all the same between the 2. Some people complain about the thin pages and ghosting. I do not mind that, but I DO mind bleeding! I use fountain pens with fine or extra fine nibs, so the ink should NOT be bleeding. My first journal had very good, high quality, smooth paper that was very fountain pen friendly. This one is terrible. $20 for a notebook with such low quality paper is a HUGE disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Karin Martinez

customer_reviews.title: A very good quality journal
customer_reviews.text: 6 months into this bullet journal experiment and I find myself more organized and prepared than my previous “I’ll remember that” attitude. This journal itself is sturdy and has held up to abuse. The paper is of good quality and, aside from sections being ever so slightly overglued at the spine from time to time, I have no complaints. I’ll be purchasing another once this one fills up.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Cox

customer_reviews.title: Holy cow,  I NEVER leave 5 star ratings
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these books. I will never go back. The book has a wonderfully solid feel and the paper is luscious----smooth, sturdy, rich. It makes any pen feel like some expensive executive pen. There's no bleed through. I especially love that you get to label the pages. I always feel kind of guilty if I don't do every day, but this book I just date a page myself. I'm going to have to check out the whole inventory.
customer_reviews.author: ginmar

customer_reviews.title: Ink bleeds right on through
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2020 bullet journal. The notebook itself feels nice and has plenty of pages. I like the two bookmarks and pocket at the back. But the pages are way too thin! I use PaperMate inkjoy gel pens and the bleed though is horrible! I won’t be buying this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Pat C.

customer_reviews.title: Good journal, but not for me
customer_reviews.text: The Leuchtturm is a great notebook, just not what I needed for my style of bullet journaling! I like to do a lot of art and fancy brush lettering in my journal and the pages were just a little to thin as you could easily see the marker/pen strokes on the opposite side of the page. This left my spreads looking messy. A lot of people love this journal, it just wasn’t for me! It was a great beginners journal and it’s gotten a lot of use as a practice journal for when I want to practice drawing and whatnot!
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Best bullet journal notebook—Not for coloring
customer_reviews.text: Everything you could want in a dotted notebook. First dotted notebook that’s not branded Bullet journal and so happy with purchase. Being lighter in color, the dings and scratches on the covers are less noticeable than the black. True to color. Disclaimer: Look, these notebooks are meant for a regular pen. Yes there will be light ghosting with a pen, but you want thicker, sturdier paper if you’re going to color all over it.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Yes, has ghosting, but it's a really nicely designed notebook!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, the biggest downside of this notebook are its thin pages, which result in ink ghosting to the page behind the one you're writing on. However, it's a really nicely designed notebook, with index pages, numbered pages, a few perforated pages at the back, a nice pocket in the back, and stickers for the spine and cover so you can label your notebook! If ghosting really bothers you, try the Minimalism Art A5 Dotted Page notebook, which has much thicker paper and won't ghost (at least with my Zebra Sarasa Dry 0.4mm pen's ink).
customer_reviews.author: K. Lew

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Quality
customer_reviews.text: I love this journal. The pages aren't thick as cardstock but it withstands a lot of ink and prevents excessive ink bleedthrough. The pages are cream-coloured and dotted. The outer cover is hard enough to be sturdy for everyday use. Mine came dented in the corner however (see attached pictures). This journal is great for fountain pens, by the way. :) There is a hidden pocket in the back for little receipts or notes as well as two bookmark ribbons.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Bui

customer_reviews.title: Kind of Aggravated by Changes in the Last Year
customer_reviews.text: It's still has the excellent durability factor. Still love the numbered pages. Don't like the changes they made to the index pages (I really liked the "Table" format instead of the lines with gaps.) And they went from having 38 dots in the vertical direction to 37. This sounds like a little thing, but 37 is a prime number, so if you're using the dots as a guide for drawing a table, you can't get them evenly spaced without wasted space. It's annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Ball

customer_reviews.title: Good for Bullet Journals, not for anti-ghosting
customer_reviews.text: It's a good book for my Bullet Journal, easy to spot in the black hole that is my purse, I like the fact that the pages are numbered and that there's an index ready to use. Pros: Index alread made, numbered pages, dotted, two bookmarks, bright color options, even the option of dotted or grid pages if you prefer that. Cons: Somewhat difficult to find locally. There is some ghosting with Staedtler Fineliners, Tombows, pretty much most pens are going to have some ghosting, and the harder you press/the heavier handed you are the more obvious it becomes (If you're cautious/light handed, you won't have as much).
customer_reviews.author: huskersgirllaura

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful thing
customer_reviews.text: This is my..... fourth? Of these journals. I love the versatility of dots - I need graph paper of some kind for my scientific research journals, but a full grid can make it challenging to read my textual notes. Dots are the perfect solution. The index in the front is also INCREDIBLY helpful for keeping track of where my most frequently referenced notes are. I do also use these for personal journals as well... the first one lasted me 2.5 years, I think, and it is full of ticket stubs and maps and business cards, etc - paper souvenirs from trips - so it's bulked up quite a bit, and yet it's still sturdy as heck.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Bell

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing for the price
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to find a new notebook to replace my well used Rhodes Webnotebook which is nearly full. First, the cover was dented upon arrival, which isn’t the products fault as much as the shipping. Then I removed the plastic wrap and the chemical smell was awful. The notebooks a good size and it’s densely packed which is nice. There’s definitely more pages than my old Rhodia. I did a pen test on the last page and I couldn’t be more disappointed. My favorite fountain pen bled like crazy. Even my metallic gel pens are ghosting through. For a journal at this price and this well known I expected a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: First BulletJournal, Decent, But Ink Will Bleed
customer_reviews.text: I received this in great condition. There was just a minor ding on the edge, but nothing that can't be overlooked. The quality is decent, except that it does have a bleed thru problem. I have used the black prismacolor pens, tombow dual pens, and the staedtler fineliner pens, and they bleed. This is a little off putting but since this is my first bullet journal, I'm learning along the way. Overall, it's not bad. It comes with archiving labels to out on the front cover and spine, if you choose to keep using this type of notebook for the years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Jayme

customer_reviews.title: Thin pages- ink leaks through.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bullet journal for my 13 year old daughter for Christmas..... had alot of good reviews and i figured for$19.99 it would be good quality. However, she started bullet journaling today and the pages are too thin- ink is leaking through to the other side, which is not what a bullet journalist wants! Very disappointed in this product. Hoping i can get a replacement or my money back. Everything else about the journal is nice, but the pages ARE TOO THIN!
customer_reviews.author: BsB

customer_reviews.title: Nice book, thin pages
customer_reviews.text: As a big fan of bullet journaling, I'm always excited about my next journal. In preparation for the new year, I got this journal. While I like the color, the dotted pages, page numbers, and the two page-holder ribbons, I am quite disappointed with the page thickness. Even a light, non-permanent marker, will show through. If you are a marker user, this probably isn't the journal for you. I have resigned myself to colored pencils and using only one side of the page in 2019.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl_S

customer_reviews.title: BEST JOURNAL Notebook!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these journals. They come in beautiful colors. The quality of the paper is something I haven't found in any other journal. It almost feels like fabric to me. My pens do not bleed through and there is little to no ghosting. I don't like real thick paper and I don't like too thin paper, so this is just perfect for me. I am on my fourth journal and the quality is unmatched. The extra features such as the index, numbered pages, the perforated pages, the back pocket, the 2 bookmarks and the elastic closure band are bonus features to an already perfect product. I use my journal constantly several times throughout every day and they hold up like new.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Rathbun

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful journals
customer_reviews.text: As a first time bullet journaler, I was recommended this particular brand by my sister and mentor who love theirs to pieces. I have two, one which I use for recording books and one for daily planning. These journals are beautiful and sturdy . The index is a nice touch and I appreciate that the pages are numbered, so I can refer back to pages throughout. The pages are a nice thickness so if you go a little heavy on the ink, it ghosts on the other side but doesn't completely bleed through. I switch between the Muji 0.38 pens and Sharpie Fine Point pens.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: SEE THROUGH!  & Most arrive damaged per reviws !
customer_reviews.text: Sooooo see through! That’s probably the number one complaint I have. Good side- I don’t have any issues with smudges or bleeding through. This notebook is small. Next time I might get a bujo that is 8x11 instead of a 5X8. The bottom binding came dented/damaged. I’ve seen that this happens a lot with packaging and shipping. Should of just bought in person at a Barnes and noble and inspected it before I bought. The return takes away $5 from my purchase so I didn’t want to return it and lose $5. Oh well. Won’t but again though. But will do trick for now
customer_reviews.author: Aleesuh

customer_reviews.title: Great for Bullet Journals!
customer_reviews.text: I love the band that holds it shut, and the two decorative ribbons. The paper is perfect. Even had a folder in back and a built-in index. Includes stickers for labeling. Just don't know what else to say, but it is topnotch. I got a yellow one, and my only complaint is that the yellow dots are a little light-colored for my taste. Very nice to have the dot type journal rather than lined.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetpea

customer_reviews.title: Obsessed!
customer_reviews.text: It's my first time bullet journaling and I'm three months in now and I'm obsessed. I love the dotted paper, it keeps things tidy but still allows for a lot of flexibility. Great quality and looks super polished at meetings. I'll absolutely be repurchasing when I get through this one. At my current pace, I should get at least 5-6 months use out of one notebook.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Pezzanite

customer_reviews.title: Nice for bullet journaling but paper much thinner than expected
customer_reviews.text: I got this notepad for bullet journaling. It’s well made and I love the numbered pages. I am surprised tho that literally every pen, midlighter, & fine marker I have shows through on the backside of the paper. I thought the advantage of spending more for this brand was that there was no ghosting. Unless the product has changed drastically lately, I’m not sure how people could say there is no ghosting. Unless all they use are soft pencils. That being said, I like how well made it is and will most likely order this again.
customer_reviews.author: PNW Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good journal. Sharpies bleed, Tombows ghost.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the hard cover and the convenient pocket in the back. I’d really like a little thicker paper for a journal so I can use Sharpies without bleeding through. I went ahead and purchased some Tombow markers since my Sharpies aren’t gentle enough for the pages. Even the Tombow markers ghost through the pages, though. However, this journal is keeping my life more organized than my life was without it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica B.

customer_reviews.title: This Is the Leuchtturm1917 To Get
customer_reviews.text: I recently became interested in journaling for creative, profession, personal, and general schedule-making needs. I'm also one who when waiting somewhere like a restaurant waiting area or a health clinic would rather bullet journal than go on my smartphone. After researching journals, I became sold on the Leuchtturm1917 series. So far I've purchased 3, a college-ruled lined one with 249 pages, a dotted one with 126 pages, and the one here, a numbered 249-page dotted version and by far my favorite. I prefer the flexibility of the dots to lines and I prefer 249 pages to ones that are half that length. So for me this is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: M. JEFFREY MCMAHON

customer_reviews.title: Very Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased my first Leuchtturm to start a bullet journal. I did a lot of reading and this was highly recommended. It is beautiful, well made, and I thought I would love it. I don't. The paper is so thin that the bleed through from even the best and most recommended pens was very bad. I have already ordered a completely different journal. I'm not a great artist and so my use of colored pens was very limited. However, the pages looked messy and because of the bleed-through from the other side. Very sorry to have to give the journal this review.
customer_reviews.author: Flight49

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite journal
customer_reviews.text: Review of:] After lots of research, I decided to try the Leuchtturm 1917 dotted journal. It was an excellent choice for my needs. The pages are numbered, there's a place in the front for an index, and the size is perfect. I absolutely love the dotted pattern, rather than ruled lines. The dots are unobtrusive, and they help me control the tendency of my writing to crawl all over the page. When this journal is filled, I'll buy another. I plan to use different colors for each year; the hard part is selecting the color from all the choices.
customer_reviews.author: LuvDachsies

customer_reviews.title: Not the same Leuchtturm quality
customer_reviews.text: The new material they are using for the cover is terrible. I had my previous one and I've used it heavily for 2 years and it barely has a few dents. There is already a white color showing through the cover of my new notebook - and I have been treating it so gently for the 1.5 months that I've had it. I'm all on board with vegan leather, but this is not quality material.
customer_reviews.author: medstudent92

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I read a blog from a dot journalist who only uses this brand of notebook. I was extremely happy with my first dot journal from another company, slightly smaller, much more inexpensive, thicker paper, but the pages were not numbered and did not have an index. The paper on the Leuchtturm is extremely thin and everything ghosts through on the page behind. I wouldn't have purchased this if I had known how bad it was, and obviously cannot return it because I have written on a couple pages. Very very disappointed in this purchase. I am undecided if I want to continue to use it and be annoyed for the whole year.
customer_reviews.author: J & H Hattori

customer_reviews.title: I love it, this is my favorite notebook!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase. I love this notebook so much that I won't be using any other kind. I use the back page as a pen tester & have not had any problems. My favorite pen, the BIC Atlantis writes lovely in it plus I use watercolor & matte acrylic craft paints, No problems! I suggest avoiding all alcohol based pens & markers as they will bleed through & if you're not sure then make a test page in an inconspicuous area like a back page. I love this notebook!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Nagelin

customer_reviews.title: I now believe in ghosts...not the quality I thought I was paying for.
customer_reviews.text: This is promoted with paper quality able to handle fountain pens or markers for journaling. It does neither. Disappointed. The cost is fair if it can do the job. It doesn't. The paper is porous and ink bleeds. Ghosting is another issue I did not appreciate it. Oh well. My search continues. When I find it, I will let you know. :(
customer_reviews.author: T. Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Great journal, wish pages were thicker.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Leuchtturm I’m using for bullet journaling. It’s a great, sturdy journal with faint dots that nicely blend into the background. However, I wish the paper was thicker. I mostly use regular pens for my layouts but I find the pages are too thin for a $20 journal. It’s not enough to throw it out and buy something else but I can definitely see my writing through the pages.
customer_reviews.author: Windy Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Ordering my 2nd one
customer_reviews.text: This notebook is great for Bullet Journaling and I'm on my second year. If you knew me, you'd know that means it's a great product. I rarely stick with anything. I like the lightly dotted pages as it helps me if I want to make a quick chart. This format lends itself to sketching, writing, graphing or anything you need to do. I used it heavily in 2018 and plan to do it again in 2019. I also found the paper was heavy enough for the journaling I do (though I'm not artistic if that helps).
customer_reviews.author: Mary A. Cavanaugh

customer_reviews.title: I love these notebooks
customer_reviews.text: Leuttchurm is my favorite notebook brand. They aren’t always perfect, but they are always sturdy. One of these travels around in my pocket 24/7, and I go through several a year. They are great with gel and ballpoint inks, and the pack pockets can go the distance without tearing. The elastic is sturdy and lasts a long time. Overall, a great day-to-day traveling notebook.
customer_reviews.author: Alan M Rogers

customer_reviews.title: A nice notebook, but...
customer_reviews.text: I love the size and feel of this notebook, I especially love the beautiful color options, which sets it apart from Moleskine. The downside, which is the same problem I have with the Moleskine, is the thickness of the paper. I dont really have a problem with "ghosting," but if I'm spending this much on a notebook, I would want better quality paper. Still, it gets the job done, in comes in my favorite color and it's not heavy for being a hardback.
customer_reviews.author: Naima Dillard Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Best bullet journal. Robust
customer_reviews.text: Nice paper. Doesn’t bleed. Has numbered pages essential for index of Bullet Journal. Fine dots on the page to help with orthogonal drawing or keeping lines straight. Has 2 ribbon page markers. Has pocket for loose paper. Strong binding. elastic band to keep closed. I have filled four of these. Last me a year.+. Good size. I use FABER CASTLE PPT S and M Artists pens. Also takes fine point Sharpie.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Niec

customer_reviews.title: Durable (Way more so then Moleskine), No Ink Bleed, Professional Appearance- What else do You need?
customer_reviews.text: Have used this product daily for a couple years as my daily (Bullet) journal. Get a new one every quarter or sooner. It’s in constant use, I probably open it, close it, and carry it to another meeting 5 times a day and not one has ever failed at the binding. TOP Quality. Changed to this product after Moleskine could not last the 3-4 months of daily use I needed. I use sharpie pens and no issue with bleed through and I write and or draw/doodle constantly. A couple more bucks than others but worth every penny. Try the “Band Joes” with it as pen holders and it is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W Grimes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for bullet journaling!
customer_reviews.text: I saw reviews saying that they tried a fineliner sharpie and it bled through. I wanted to test that out, but instead of being smart and testing it on a small area, I tested it on the number 2 for my 2017 Goals page. Turns out, the sharpies do bleed through a lot!!! But my fineliner markers (AmazaPens) didn't bleed through very much at all. The colors did show through a little, but not much, and plain lines didn't show through at all. Overall, I love this journal. The bullet points make it super easy to be precise
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great for creating your own format for a journal or calendar
customer_reviews.text: I like this product because I can just use it to write down whatever is important to me. I use it for my own design of bullet journaling and put it in a calendar form with reminders and notes of what I need to do or have done. I do a lot of book reviews and make notes of those that I have done. I add Bible verses and creative scribbles and timelines, etc. The dot format gives a guide without being very obvious, like a lined format does. It has a nice cover in a variety of colors.
customer_reviews.author: G Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect style, some ghosting
customer_reviews.text: So far I love it. The corner of the cover was damaged when it arrived but other than that it's perfect for bullet journaling. The pages are thin, which doesn't bother me too much but it is definitely something to be aware of. The pictures attached show the ghosting with various thicknesses of pen. I guess I don't press down very hard because I haven't really had trouble with a normal ballpoint pen. Although the brush pens I use do bleed through some, but I haven't had them transfer to the other pages. I'm not super uptight about my bullet journal so it doesn't bother me, but it could be a turn off to some.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Eh- not for the bullet journal inclined
customer_reviews.text: First, it took almost a month for the product to arrive with the use of Prime, and was not even shipped until an inquiring email was sent. Once the product actually arrived I was very happy with the cover, the pocket at the back of the book, and that it had two book marks. When I began to use the product I was pretty disappointed about the thinness of the pages. You are able to see what you wrote or drew on the back of the page. As someone who bullet journals, this was not the right product for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty close to perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best notebooks I've found for bullet journaling. I've tried ordering the cheaper ones from other brands, but always come back to this notebook. The most important factors for me are the lighter dots and page numbers. It holds up well to a lot of moving around and being tossed into my backpack day after day. It doesn't get 5 stars because the dots are darker than when I've purchased this notebook previously. I reached out to the company and their response was "We are still working on improving our colors and shades." Even with the darker dots, it's the best choice.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren D

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and perfect
customer_reviews.text: The height x width is my favorite -- easy to hold, easy to write in, and sturdy/strong. I can lay it flat, fold it back, or keep it securely closed with ease. I am nearing the end of this one barely and I use it everyday. I use ink pens, rarely some ball points if I forget my own pen(s), and the bleed-through is very minimal, if any. I tend to hover so no paper survives that. :)
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana Ghelfi

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this journal! This brand was highly recommended by many of the intense bullet journalists I follow on social media. It has certainly lived up to its reputation. The bright orange is just right (exactly like the photo) and certainly keeps me from leaving it behind anywhere. Even though it is a hardcover, it opens flat which is useful when drawings and grids need to run onto the next page. You will be able to see the design through the other side of the page. No bleeding, just the paper is not super thick. I expected that considering I mostly use pen in the notebook. If that will drive you nuts, do not buy this journal.
customer_reviews.author: BusyZee

customer_reviews.title: A little pricey but an awesome notebook
customer_reviews.text: I love the Leuchtturm1917 notebooks. I've tried the hardcover as well as softcover and like them both. The paper is great, there's rarely any bleed through and they have been durable for everyday use. They have page numbers on each page which is a big plus. This makes indexing and referencing pages very easy and you don't forget or misnumber the pages by accident as you are taking notes. If I had a complaint, it would be the price. These are definitely a premium priced product, especially with the Essentials notebook out there for $8 cheaper (fewer pages, but still a better deal only with no numbered pages).
customer_reviews.author: W. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure there is anything I can say about the Leuchtturm1917 that hasn't already been said. This is a quality journal, good paper and ribbons to let you mark where you are or something else important. Do pens bleed? Yes some. Do pens "ghost"? Yes some. More than not, I have loads of great, high quality pens that work perfectly in my Leuchtturm. I do recommend this journal. I got the purple, dotted one in hardcover and I couldn't be more pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Cook

customer_reviews.title: Pages too thin!
customer_reviews.text: I like the size, color, and minimalist style of this journal, but the pages are simply too thin - all of my pens bleed through. :( I use the Tombow dual-tips, uniball ballpoints, and the occasional gel pen. They all shadow and the Tombows will stain the next page. I can only use one side of each page, which seems like such a waste, and I'm not able to make a full spread unless I sacrifice the other side of something. Will keep looking once I finish this one.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Wilson

customer_reviews.title: A favorite old friend
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely one of my favorite notebooks especially for bullet journals. I like the page count (just enough to not be overwhelming) as well as the thinness to it. The cover is nice and easy to decorate. The paper is lovely and have ghosting, but not bleedthrough for reasonable writing tools. It's the perfect combo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bullet journal
customer_reviews.text: If you’re into bullet journaling and you’ve done your research, you know this is one of the most commonly suggested notebooks. It definitely holds up to its reputation. Pros: there isn’t any bleeding; you can choose a full grid (essentially graph paper) or just dot grid; there is a wide variety of colors to choose from; and the pages are numbered. Cons: there are less expensive and greener options out there (but you sacrifice some of the quality). Overall, I think this is great for someone who is ready to make the investment. If you’re starting your first bullet journal, maybe you want to start with something a little more economical.
customer_reviews.author: Stefani

customer_reviews.title: One of the best notebooks I’ve ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve gone through a lot of different brands of notebooks and the Leuchtturm is by far my favorite. The built in page index and page numbers are both a huge draw for me. I will say that when using certain types of pens, highlighters, or markers, you can see through what’s written on the other side of the page. However, I still give it a 5-star rating because that doesn’t really bother me and it’s rare I use a pen in this notebook that bleeds that badly. This is one of the best notebooks you can get for bullet journaling.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

product_meta.title: Leuchtturm1917 Medium A5 Dotted Hardcover Notebook (Black) - 249 Numbered Pages
